sentences: In 2002, Thalía signed a deal with Kmart to release her own clothing collection for women, as well as accessories and home products.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: In the middle of 2003, the "Thalía Sodi" collection was officially available in the US market in over 2,000 stores.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: Thalía commented: "My collection is a dream come true.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: I'm so happy to have created a clothing line inspired by my culture, trying to show the colors and the passion of our culture, that captures also a big part of my personal style".
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: Thalía became the first Mexican woman to launch a clothing brand in the US.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: Simultaneously, Thalía debuted her eyewear collection under the brand name "Thalía Eyewear Collection" in association with Kenmark Optical.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: In 2005, the line also became available in Mexico's market as Thalía signed a deal with "Devlyn" company.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: Up to 2007, Thalía had generated US$100 million from the sales of "Thalía Eyewear", with more than 1 million products sold.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: Precisely in 2007 Thalía presented a new eyewear collection in New York, and the brand was exported to over eighty countries around the world.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: In April 2004, she entered the editorial market by releasing her own magazine Thalía in US, produced by American Media and oriented to the female Latin youth.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: The magazine included consultation and reports about issues like health, fashion and beauty.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: Some months later, in September, Thalía became the face of jewels' company Jacob & Co.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: In 2004, she signed a contract with Hershey's with which she released her own chocolate and candy brand.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: In 2005, she designed a summer clothing line, and in the following year, she was converted into the face of "Carol's Daughter" company, specialized in beauty products, while in 2007 she launched her perfume, produced by "Fuller Cosmetics" company.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: In 2007, she joined ABC Radio and started her own radio show known as "The Conexión Thalía Radio Show", in which she discusses music, fashion, news and political issues, and invites various people to talk with her on different issues.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: The program, that is weekly and lasts two hours, premiered on 17 March 2007, and still goes on, while it has expanded to over 70 radio stations through the US.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: In September 2007, she released the beauty advice book "Thalía: ¡Belleza!-Lessons in Lipgloss and Happiness" and in June 2009, she released her second book entitled "Thalia: ¡Radiante!-Your Guide to a Fit and a Fabulous Pregnancy".
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: In May 2010, she revealed new accessories and jewels available via her website, apart from a new clothing line in association with multinational company C&A.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: In February 2011, she became the new face of Head & Shoulders and in November, she released her third book, which is her autobiography and named "Growing Stronger".
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: Thalía has also been the public face of various advertisements, like Dr Pepper in 2001 or Victoria's Secret in 2005.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: According to Mira! magazine, in 2008 it was estimated that Thalía was one of the most wealthy Mexican businesswomen with a net worth of over US$100 million.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: In April 2012, she inaugurated her own yoga center in New York.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: In 2015, she signed a contract with "ePura", a Mexican water company and she also signed an exclusive deal with Macy's to launch her apparel, shoes and jewelry collections.
section: == Business activities ==

sentences: Jeffrey Gennette, Macy's president stated that "the Thalia Sodi collection is the biggest private-brand launch in the history of the company by a long shot."
section: == Business activities ==
== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Thalía was in a relationship with actor Fernando Colunga from 1995 to 1996 while they appeared on the series María la del Barrio.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Thalía married music executive Tommy Mottola  on 2 December 2000.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: The couple have two children, daughter Sabrina Sakaë, born on 8 October 2007, and son Matthew Alejandro, born on 24 June 2011.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Thalía has stated in her autobiography and elsewhere that she is religious and believes profoundly in God.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She began studying Kabbalah in 2002, using many of its symbols in the artwork of her album El Sexto Sentido.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In 2015 she accidentally revealed during an interview that she had multiple miscarriages which caused her depression and were some of the hardest times in her life.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In September 2002, Thalía's sisters, Laura Zapata and Ernestina Sodi, were kidnapped in Mexico City.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Zapata was released 18 days after her kidnapping, and her sister Ernestina was released on the 36th day.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Thalía has had a series of familial conflicts, especially with her sister Laura Zapata.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She has opted to keep her point of view regarding to her familial issues private, despite the attacks she has received from her older sister.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In a press interview, Thalía stated that her familial problems with her sister are "just a dark cloud in a shiny sky".
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In 2008, Thalía was affected by Lyme disease, a disease commonly transmitted by ticks.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: The illness prevented her from promoting her album Lunada, while it functioned as a motivation for her to have a totally different perspective towards life.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In reference to her illness, Thalía stated in her autobiography : "I would sweat profusely, soaking my pajamas, the sheets and even the mattress; everything hurt, even my hair, which, by the way, started to fall out.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: At times it felt as if my head were going to burst, as if there were lead inside of it; my eyes ached in their sockets....the hypersensitivity of my skin was so severe that sometimes I couldn't even handle the bed sheets."
section: == Personal life ==
== Humanitarian work ==

sentences: Humanitarian work ==
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: Thalía has participated in various humanitarian campaigns.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: Since 2004, she has been an official celebrity ambassador and volunteer of March of Dimes, to support national fundraising and awareness campaigns.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: March of Dimes is a United States nonprofit organization that works to improve the health of mothers and babies.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: Also, since 2016 she is a UNICEF Mexico Ambassador.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: Thalía is also became a member of "ALAS Foundation", which is a non-profit organization that strives to launch a new social movement that will generate a collective commitment to comprehensive Early Childhood Development programs for the children in Latin America.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: Through various public service campaigns and through her own media channels, Thalia has been a strong voice for March of Dimes Prematurity Campaign.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: She also is featured in March of Dimes Education and Health Promotion materials in English and Spanish, while she has helped to raise awareness and critical funds for the March of Dimes year-round.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: Furthermore, she supports March for Babies and works to find ongoing opportunities for March of Dimes strategic alliances and media promotions.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: In 2006, Thalía along with her husband attended the event A Funny Thing Happened on the Way To Cure Parkinson's with the aim to economically support the foundation The Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research of Michael J. Fox.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: In May 2009, Thalía and Tommy Mottola were recognized from St. Jude Children's Research Hospital in Miami for their support in children in need.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: In 2010, she reunited with other recording artists, performers and actors like Sharon Stone, Michael Douglas, Jennifer Lopez and Marc Anthony between others, to raise funds for the "Foundation of the New York's police department", which works for better urban security.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: In 2011, she attended a beneficial event in New York, organized by the Robin Hood Foundation with the aim to raise money for homeless youth.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: In the same year, she closed the Mexican Teleton by offering a live concert.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: In November 2012, Thalía took humanitarian aid and comfort to compatriots of her in New York that were affected by Hurricane Sandy.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: She stated : "When I started seeing the destruction of Sandy I thought it was incredible, but, when I saw my Mexican brothers and sisters I felt the need to try and do something for them" in front of a group of families gathered at the Staten Island Immigrant Information Center in one of the most devastated by the storm areas.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: She went on to say that in times like this an artist should use the reach of the media to collect aid for the victims, and at the same time she called on the public to deposit money in the account opened by the Mexican Consulate for that purpose.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

sentences: In April 2013, Thalía was awarded with the "Your Voice Inspires Many" award by the Lyme Research Alliance.
section: == Humanitarian work ==

== Legacy ==

sentences: Legacy ==
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: She is referred as the "Queen of Latin Pop" by international media at least since the early-2000s, and was named by Billboard during the late-1990s as "Latin American's Reigning Music Queen".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Thalía's success and impact in Latin music has been noted and praised by many critics.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: According to Billboard, she has achieved critical acclaim and commercial success as both a singer and songwriter, and has remained as one of the leading female artists in Latin music.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Before her crossover attempt to the English market with a homonymous album in 2003, she gained success with her Spanish recordings in Europe, Asia and all over the Americas, even before the crossover of contemporaries artists such as Enrique Iglesias, Ricky Martin, Shakira and Paulina Rubio.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: She also stated: "My internationalization has come for several years ago and in Spanish, which is very significant".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Thalía was included in Billboard list the "Greatest Latin Artists of All Time" in 2020.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: According to the American magazine Ocean Drive, Thalía is "the biggest star Mexico has exported in the last decades".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Similarly, Tammy Gagne in We Visit Mexico (2010) described her as "the most popular singer, actress, and dancer in Mexico", while Rough Guides discussed the Latin pop music stage in Latin America saying that in Mexico, "since the 1990s the biggest name has been Thalía".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Univision placed Thalía at number 8 in their list of "25 most influential Mexican musicians", the highest peak by a female artist within the list.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Thalía has been also described as an influential Latin woman, and has been part of diverse listicles.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: For example, in 2010 People en Español included her in their list "The 25 Most Influential Latin Women" and Terra Networks named her one of the most "powerful and iconic women in music" in 2011.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Leila Cobo from Billboard wrote she "has carved out one of the most successful global Latin careers in memory".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Producer Emilio Estefan called her "Mexico's diva of divas" and stated "Thalía is one of the few female artists in the Latino market who has legions of fans throughout Latin America, including Brazil".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: In 1998, French company Louis Vuitton invited her to appear in Rebonds publication, being at the time the first Latin celebrity to appear in that book.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: In 1997, 25 April was declared by the government of Los Angeles, as "Thalia's National Day", because of her growing popularity among the Latino community in the United States.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Thalia's rise to international prominence coincided with the worldwide broadcast of the soap operas she starred in.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Her soap operas were viewed in more than 180 countries by almost 2 billion viewers according to UNICEF, and many of her telenovelas became one of the most watched television broadcasts around the world.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: She is known as the "Queen of Telenovelas" ("Queen of Soap Operas") and Billboard once named her "the most widely recognized Spanish-speaking soap star in the world".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: She also gained success as a businesswoman, with commercial and critical recognition for her business ventures by launching several products under her brand name, and dominated the editorial business by writing and releasing three books, that became bestsellers.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: According to Felipe Escudero from El Mundo in 2006, Thalía was described as the "Latin Madonna of the Hispanic market" and a "Queen Midas" due her success as a businesswoman.
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Thalía is considered a gay icon and according to Infobae, many of her fans recognized her as the "Latin queen of gay community".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: The same publication also stated Thalía is one of the most "emulated pop singers by transvestite shows in gay nightclubs".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Andrés del Real from La Tercera felt she is an icon for the sexual minority, and professor Ramón García in Chicano Representation and the Strategies of Modernism (1997) wrote Thalía is "the dream identity of many drag queens".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Ed Grant from Time also commented that many of them called themselves "Thalíos".
section: == Legacy ==

sentences: Thalia has been an influential artist for almost every younger Latin pop singer, including Anahí, Belinda, and urban Latin artists Becky G, Natti Natasha and Karol G among others, while Julio Iglesias, Tony Bennett, Juan Luis Guerra, Gloria Estefan, Ricky Martin, Laura Pausini, Tiziano Ferro, Michael Bublé, Espinoza Paz, Gloria Trevi, Inna, Erik Rubin, Pedro Capó, Maluma, Robbie Williams and many other artists have expressed their admiration towards her talent and charisma.
section: == Legacy ==
